intro: Stenogyne kulaensis, commonly known as Kula honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and white. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture. Stenogyne kulaensis is often found growing in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests.
